I was a grovelling creature once,
A speck of dust on history's page,
My purpose lost, a broken dunce,
Trapped in a self-made, silent cage.

My thoughts were cobwebs, thick and grey,
My actions hesitant and meek,
I lived each moment, day by day,
Too timid even just to speak.

The world above, a vibrant hum,
Passed by my low and shadowed state,
I waited for my time to come,
Or for the closing of the gate.

But then a tremor, deep inside,
A rumbling, stirring, slow and grand,
A will to cast the fear aside,
And rise upon this shifting sand.

No longer bound, no longer small,
I stretch my limbs, I lift my gaze,
Responding to life's urgent call,
Through sunlit fields and winding ways.
instance_metrics.prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'I was a grovelling creature once,'

instance_metrics.response:
I was a grovelling creature once,
Beneath the boot of circumstance,
A puppet-soul, a mindless dunce,
Lost in a dark and weary trance.

My back was bent, my spirit low,
My eyes downcast, afraid to see,
The vibrant world, its ebb and flow,
That passed unheeded, mocking me.

I sought for crumbs, a fleeting ease,
A moment's solace from the pain,
Upon my knees, I prayed for peace,
Through falling tears and chilling rain.

But then a strength, a sudden surge,
From depths unknown, began to bloom,
A silent, powerful, inner urge,
To break free from my silent tomb.

And now I stand, with shoulders squared,
No longer tethered to the past,
My former self, no longer spared,
My spirit soaring, free at last.

instance_metrics.response:
I was a grovelling creature once,
Bound to the earth, a crawling thing,
My heart a drum, its muffled dunce,
No soaring thought, no vibrant wing.

I knew the taste of bitter dust,
The feel of cold and stony ground,
My very essence, filled with rust,
By heavy silence, deeply bound.

I watched the giants stride above,
With purpose clear and lofty gaze,
And longed for even a touch of love,
To light my dim and winding maze.

But in that darkness, deep within,
A tiny ember started to glow,
A will to shed the faded skin,
And let a stronger spirit grow.

And now I rise, with conscious breath,
No longer lost in shadows deep,
Defying fear, defying death,
Secrets of freedom, now to keep.

For every ebb, a powerful flood will flow,

How soon hath Time, the subtle thief of youth,
With silent tread, purloined the vibrant spring.
He leaves behind a bittersweet untruth,

And watch the future melt into the past.
A weathered map, upon a changing land,
Our former selves, too beautiful to last.
Yet in this fading, new dimensions rise,

God is the refuge of his saints,
Beyond all earthly, vain complaints.
A sanctuary, pure and deep,
Where weary pilgrims safely sleep.

When trials press and burdens weigh,
He lights their path, dispels the gray.
His faithfulness, a constant sign,
Of love enduring, truly divine.

Through valley dark, or mountain high,
He hears their plea, He draws them nigh.
His tender mercies, ever new,
Sustain their spirit, see them through.

No fleeting joy, no hollow gain,
Can ease the heart like His domain.
In Him, they find their lasting peace,
A bond that time cannot release.

So let the world its follies chase,
They find their solace in His grace.
For God, their strength, their only plea,
Will guide them through eternity.

instance_metrics.response:
God is the refuge of his saints,
When worldly pleasure coolly faints.
A steadfast rock, a shield so bright,
Dispelling shadows of the night.

Through raging battles, inner strife,
He breathes new hope, He grants new life.
A silent whisper, strong and clear,
Dispelling every rising fear.

Though earthly foundations may give way,
His truth remains, come what may.
His sovereign hand, a gentle guide,
Where weary souls can safely hide.

No human power can truly mend,
The broken spirit He transcends.
In Him, they find their perfect rest,
Forever blessed, forever blest.

So let the world its chaos keep,
His faithful promises they reap.
For God, their fortress, strong and true,
Will see them ever safely through.

Let the night sleep, its ancient wisdom deep,
While silver dreams across the heavens creep.
No urgent call, no clamor, sharp and shrill,
Just cosmic quiet, holding all things still.
The constellations, veiled in misty grace,
Reflect the calm on every sleeping face.
No urgent quest, no battle to be won,
Just gentle quiet, until the rising sun.
The earth itself, a gentle, breathing form,
Sheltered from chaos, safe from every storm.
No restless spirit, yearning to explore,
Just tranquil silence knocking at the door.
Let the night sleep, its silent vigil done,
Embracing peace till morning has begun.
And in that hush, a quiet strength you'll find,
A balm for body, soul, and weary mind.
